marketNews.title: The Fed Maintains Interest Rate, Strengthening the Higher for Longer Signal
marketNews.content: The US central bank, The Fed, decided to maintain its benchmark interest rate in the range of 5.25-5.5% in its meeting on Wednesday (1/5) local time, in line with consensus expectations. During the meeting, The Fed Chair, Jerome Powell, hinted that they would not raise interest rates further. However, he also stated that inflation data being higher than expected for three consecutive months in the first quarter of 2024 could cause interest rate cuts to be slower than initially anticipated. On Thursday (2/5), probability analysis from the CME FedWatch Tool showed that the market expects The Fed rate cuts to begin in September 2024, with a probability reaching 56.4%. This probability decreased compared to 58% on April 25, 2024. The narrative of persistently high US interest rates for a longer period (higher for longer) triggered selling pressure from foreign investors (outflow) in the Indonesian stock and bond markets. In the last month, the IHSG experienced a foreign outflow of IDR 20.31 trillion as of April 30, 2024. Meanwhile, as of April 29, 2024, the Indonesian bond market recorded a foreign outflow of IDR 16.73 trillion in the last month. Apart from interest rates, The Fed also announced that they will reduce the pace of balance sheet reduction starting June 1, 2024, to 25 billion US dollars per month, lower than the previous 60 billion US dollars. Meanwhile, mortgage-backed securities are still allowed to be issued with a limit of 35 billion US dollars per month. This step is aimed at ensuring the financial system does not run out of reserves, similar to what happened in 2019 during The Fed's last round of quantitative tightening.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: The Fed's signal to delay US interest rate cuts could potentially cause Bank Indonesia's interest rate expectations to remain higher for longer. Previously, in the Board of Governors Meeting in April 2024, Bank Indonesia decided to raise the BI Rate again by 25 bps to the level of 6.25% to curb the weakening of the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar. Responding to the strengthening of the higher for longer signal, the yield on the 10-year Indonesian government bond rose again by 10 bps to the level of 7.278% in trading today, Thursday (2/5). In the last 1 month, the yield has increased by 63 bps. The persistence of high interest rates for a longer period potentially suppresses the performance of several sectors, including: Property and automotive - Weakening demand due to high interest rates for Housing Ownership Loans (KPR) and Motor Vehicle Loans (KKB). Construction - High debt levels increase the interest burden that must be paid. Banking - High Cost of Fund amidst slowing CGS growth. In this case, the majority of banks have reported an increase in Cost of Fund in 1Q24, squeezing their profitability (NIM), in line with industrial data from OJK.

marketNews.title: BPS records that inflation index of consumer prices in Indonesia reached 3% YoY in April 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that inflation in the consumer price index (CPI) in Indonesia reached 3% YoY in April 2024 (vs. Mar 2024: 3.05% inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 3.06% YoY. Monthly, inflation reached 0.25% MoM (vs. Mar 2024: 0.52% MoM), marking the lowest level in the last 3 months although higher than the consensus expectation of 0.21% MoM. Core inflation reached 1.82% YoY (vs. Mar 2024: 1.77% YoY), exceeding expectations at 1.76% YoY and marking the highest level in the last 5 months.

marketNews.title: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) dropped to 52.9 in April 2024
marketNews.content: S&P Global noted that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) dropped to 52.9 in April 2024 (vs. March 2024: 54.2), marking 32 consecutive months of factory activity growth.

marketNews.title: BPS recorded that foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia reached 1.04 million in March 2024
marketNews.content: BPS recorded that foreign tourist (wisman) visits to Indonesia reached 1.04 million (-1.91% MoM, +19.86% YoY) in March 2024. During 3M24, wisman visits to Indonesia increased +25.43% YoY to 3.03 million, equivalent to 17.8% of the government target of 17 million.

marketNews.title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella announced a plan to invest USD 1.7 billion in Indonesia over the next 4 years
marketNews.content: Microsoft CEO (Nasdaq: MSFT), Satya Nadella, said that they will invest 1.7 billion US dollars in Indonesia over the next 4 years in cloud infrastructure and artificial intelligence (AI). Microsoft views Southeast Asia as a potential location for developing AI products. Based on a study from a global consulting firm, Kearney, AI can contribute nearly 1 trillion US dollars to the Southeast Asian GDP by 2030, with Indonesia expected to gain 366 billion US dollars from this amount.

marketNews.title: Surya Citra Media subsidiary, Vidio, targets doubling paid subscribers to 8 million in the next 2-3 years ahead of a potential IPO
marketNews.content: Surya Citra Media's ($SCMA) subsidiary, Vidio, targets doubling its paid subscribers to 8 million in the next 2-3 years ahead of plans to go public. Vidio CEO, Sutanto Hartono, said that they will conduct an IPO after market sentiment becomes more positive. According to Media Partners Asia data in 2023, Vidio had the highest number of paid subscribers in Indonesia with a streaming revenue share of 17%, only trailing Netflix (26%) which has higher subscription fees.

tickerNews.title: Bank Mandiri recorded Q1 2024 net profit below expectations despite strong loan growth
tickerNews.content: $BMRI: Bank Mandiri recorded a net profit of IDR 12.7 trillion (-20.6% QoQ, +1.1% YoY) in 1Q24, equivalent to 21.7% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Net Interest Income rose to IDR 24.2 trillion (+0.7% QoQ, +5.1% YoY). The quarterly drop in net profit was driven by a surge in provisioning expenses (+261% QoQ), although down -2.6% YoY. Operationally, disbursed credit grew +19.1% YoY, far above management guidance of +13-15% and industry targets from Bank Indonesia and OJK (+9-12%), while the Loan-to-Deposit Ratio rose to 89.7% (vs. 1Q23: 84.9%, 4Q23: 86.8%). On the other hand, the Net Interest Margin fell to 5.07% (vs. 1Q23: 5.4%, 4Q23: 5.15%), significantly below guidance in the range of 5.3-5.5%.

tickerNews.title: Adaro Energy Indonesia recorded net profit of USD 374 million in Q1 2024, driven by higher coal sales volume despite lower ASP
tickerNews.content: $ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia recorded a net profit of USD 374 million (-11.4% QoQ, -18.3% YoY) in 1Q24, equivalent to 35.7% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Revenue stood at USD 1.4 billion (-6.1% QoQ, -21.5% YoY), equivalent to 27.1% of the consensus FY24 estimate. The decline in core revenue was mainly caused by a decrease in the Average Selling Price (ASP) of -24% YoY, while coal sales volume rose +4.8% YoY to 16.5 million tons. Gross profit margin increased to 43.5% (vs. 4Q23: 35.7%, 1Q23: 41.5%) along with a decrease in the cost of revenue (-17.4% QoQ, -24.3% YoY). Operationally, coal production volume grew +15% YoY to 18.1 million tons, with the strip ratio recorded at 3.66x (vs. 4Q23: 4.56x, 1Q23: 3.59x).

tickerNews.title: Ace Hardware Indonesia recorded Q1 2024 net profit growth of 29.3% YoY, driven by strong SSSG
tickerNews.content: $ACES: Ace Hardware Indonesia recorded a net profit of IDR 205 billion (+29.3% YoY) in 1Q24, equivalent to 23.4% of the consensus FY24 estimate (vs. 1Q23: 20.7%). Revenue grew +17% YoY to IDR 1.9 trillion, driven by SSSG of +13.2% YoY, which was the highest cumulative 1Q SSSG since the pandemic. Cost of revenue grew +17% YoY, keeping the gross profit margin stable at 48.5%. Meanwhile, operating profit margin grew to 13.3% (+136 bps YoY) due to a decrease in opex, causing the net profit margin to grow to 10.3% (+98 bps YoY).

tickerNews.title: Indofood Sukses Makmur recorded Q1 2024 net profit of ~IDR 2.5 trillion, suppressed by substantial forex loss
tickerNews.content: $INDF: Indofood Sukses Makmur recorded a net profit of ~IDR 2.5 trillion (-36% YoY, +130% QoQ) in 1Q24, equivalent to 24% of the consensus FY24 estimate and 25% of the Stockbit FY24 estimate. Revenue reached IDR 30.8 trillion (+1% YoY, +11% QoQ), equivalent to 26% of the Stockbit and consensus FY24 estimate and below expectations, with a gross profit margin reaching 34.1% (vs. 1Q23: 31.1%, 4Q23: 35.5%). Operationally, INDF's performance was quite good with operating profit increasing to IDR 5.9 trillion (+12% YoY, +7% QoQ), in line with our expectation (30% of Stockbit FY24 estimate), although below consensus expectation (26% of consensus FY24 estimate). The low net profit in 1Q24 was suppressed by a significant forex loss of IDR 1.2 trillion (vs. 1Q23: forex gain of IDR 1.5 trillion).

tickerNews.title: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur recorded Q1 2024 net profit of ~IDR 2.4 trillion, recovering from a net loss in Q4 2023
tickerNews.content: $ICBP: Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur recorded a net profit of ~IDR 2.4 trillion (-41% YoY), improving from a net loss of IDR 69 billion in 4Q23. This result is equivalent to 24% of the consensus FY24 estimate and below expectations. Revenue grew to IDR 19.9 trillion (+4% YoY, +20% QoQ), equivalent to 27% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Operating profit grew +12% YoY and +33% QoQ, but net profit declined year-on-year due to forex loss.

tickerNews.title: Bukit Asam recorded Q1 2024 net profit of IDR 791 billion, missing expectations due to margin compression
tickerNews.content: $PTBA: Bukit Asam recorded a net profit of IDR 791 billion (-66% QoQ, -32% YoY) in 1Q24, lower than expected as it only met 15.5% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Revenue decreased to IDR 9.4 trillion (-12.5% QoQ, -5.5% YoY), relatively in line (24.6%) with the consensus FY24 estimate, although sales still grew year-on-year (-3% QoQ, +10.2% YoY). Gross profit margin was eroded to 15.1% (vs. 4Q23: 30.1%, 1Q23: 20.7%) due to an increase in the cost of revenue to IDR 8 trillion (+6.3% QoQ, +1.1% YoY). Operationally, PTBA recorded an increase in coal production volume of +7.4% YoY to 7.3 million tons.
